description: This application makes backups of everything! I messed up something, and Timeshift saved the day! Oh, thanks to the devs!

I accidentally uninstalled pulseaudio and gnome shell and their dependencies and i wish I could install them back but didn't know how to... thankfully I have been keeping snapshots often and it worked without a hitch!
Keeps making snapshots on it's own WITHOUT PERMISSION, eventually filling the whole disk and crashing the system. This has happened three times in last 12 hours.
Have used it once only but trying it as much as I can

This has saved me more than once. Same function as Windows "Restore Point". Backs up and restores the system, NOT user data. Can restore using a boot disk if the system fails to boot. Just be sure to exclude the folder where the backups are stored, if that partition is mounted, otherwise it backs up itself until the disk is full.
summary: First app I add to a fresh install

description:
I'm just now installing on Mate via the "Software" app, so hopefully it will work flawlessly as it did on Mint. I never tried Restoring with Timeshift, but by all accounts it does that reliably too from it's clear GUI interface. Kudos and thanks to the devs! 

One question though, why is the description not displayed in English when that's the language installed?
summary: Linux Newbie - Used this on Mint, now on Ubuntu Mate

description: Great tool to use when you need to restore everything, much better than the Deja Dup backup tool.
Fantastic i recommend it.
The perfect tool to restore from any manual/automatic snapshot. Maybe need a guided tool that show how to format and use disk with BTRFS system.
It helps me to save my time after something is wrong with my system.
Never "reinstall Linux because some install messed up everything" again !

i installed kde display manager to try it on my ubuntu 20.04 and then after playing with it, i didn't liked it so decided to uninstall it. Then I found out its not possible, so I used time shift to restore my complete root directory which didn't completely remove the kde dm and so I had to reinstall ubuntu
summary: does what it says except one thing

description: This is the best backup tool around. User friendly, unobstrusive, fast, and full featured.
This app is a must have on any pc! Especially useful for those who are new to Linux!
quick and easy to use

Timeshift makes me feel free to do anything without worries.
I also love the automatic snapshot feature.
Must install.
Easy to use, efficient, awesome!
summary: Amazing utillity to back up the system!

description: This should be installed by default in all linux .I dont understand why ubuntu not including it by default.It will save you if you messed up with the settiing or bad update .Very usefull install it now and create restore point.
summary: Its most usefull App install it ASAP

description: Great app, would recommend
Great GUI and it actually backs up my system. Very nice for a newbie!
summary: Works great and easy to use!

description: This application help you to restore your system if you messed up something.

Yes, backing up is/can be dangerous.

Because of THIS PROGRAM I lost my machine for 4 weeks!

I have a 500GB drive.  I plugged in a 5 TB drive.
Selected it and away it went.

Alas THE PROGRAM decided that because the drive was formatted in NTFS, it would change which drive is being used and so uesd the same partition as the source.

An 80% full HD can't be backed up onto itself.

Subsequently it FILLED the drive to 100% full.
(Shame on me for now knowing better then)

But as a result I didn't have a computer (this one) for 4 weeks.

It is STUPID BEYOND BELIEF that THE PROGRAM can change the selected destination drive if "it doesn't like the formatting".

Rather than saying "HEY STOP! THIS DRIVE ISN'T USABLE! Format it to EXT4 first!"  It just writes to a nominal drive.  As I only have ONE SSD, guess which one it chose.

That is poor program writing in my books.

Yes, shame on me for taking 4 weeks to get it fixed.
But it would not have happened if the program had CLEARLY told me it needed the other partition to be EXT4 and aborted.

Rather it just carried on anyway.
Very good but no tray icon when it is actually performing a snapshot. Some kind of notification would be nice so as not to shutdoown one's computer in the middle of a snapshot.
summary: very good but no tray icon

description: Very cool app, saved my Linux install a few times

I'm trying to make a full backup to a USB stick using Timeshift. 
For some reason the backup cancels itself after a very long time. Each time I put that particular USB stick in it restarts immediately with a full backup taking a lot of resources. Even when i kill the Timeshift job, it restarts itself over and over. In the Timeshift app I never see a line that a backup exists, probably because they get cancelled for some reason.
I've uninstalled Timeshift for now because my USB stick is occupied all the time. I think I have to experiment more with Timeshift, but if I find another full backup tool I will certainly no longer use Timeshift.
summary: It keeps running over and over taking all resources

description: more then 8 times i restore Linux mint. Timeshift is very cool.
it saved my life
This app helped me a lot to work with my ubuntu desktop.
Using it on Ubuntu 20.10 Desktop on Raspberry pi 4 with BTRFS
summary: Works great for me with BTRFS

description:
This program has saved my butt so many times. It's not meant for home backups although you can do that if you wish. If you use it for a home drive backup and restore, you would lose any changed or added personal files. 

The idea is to backup your system files and if something goes badly, you can roll back your system even if you can't boot into the OS itself. Just boot from a flash drive with Timeshift on it (or install it in live mode), do the restore and reboot. You're back in action. I've never had a problem with it.

I enjoy solving system problems and so when I do revert to backup in defeat, I'm usually just one crash away from a total. Timeshift is *actually, literally* the only local backup plan out of all I've tried all that's always gotten me back to "Square T-minus-[X-reboots]". It just works. Thank you Timeshift, for my salvaged bacon!
this thing saved my hide a few dozen times, no word of a lie

After restoring a backup created 10 mins ago, my network stopped working. Connection available and established, but internet is not available. Reinstall from scratch - internet present. So this is app is cr@pw@re

When restoring a backup you'll encounter a screen with a "Warning" and a "Disclaimer". Initially the fields below these two words will be empty. If you click on "Next" before these fields fill out, the restore will fail. It takes anywhere between seconds and 20 minutes (my case) for that to happen. Usually about a minute or two. This bug has been reported as far back as 2018 and just doesn't seem to get any attention from the dev. A damn shame because otherwise this app is brilliant and essential.
summary: One serious bug otherwise brilliant app

description:
Like system restore but 10x better 
Thank you so much Dev

It can be lifesaver. I had an issue that broke my DNS resolution and no solution was working. Used Timeshift and was back to working within 15 minutes. Another great use although I'd recommend trying this on another machine, is if you try major change like Gnome to KDE, this will allow you to roll back things. It cannot get every little detail but almost everything and is better than most backup / restore utilities, definitely faster. Only issues I had at all was Windows on dual boot needs to do quick scan disk when it boots up again since bootloader changed slightly. That is normal but can be scary if you don't know better and think resolving your Linux issue just broke Windows. 

I can't say enough good things through, truly a lifesaver.
summary: It works to the point I made sure to donate money to developer

description: Easiest backup solution. Works smooth with Btrfs.
Used it for a while and it's just great

I have used this program in the past and I really liked it.
It saves me lots of time in case if my system decides to stop working or if I break it on accident.

The only thing I want to be added is Btrfs support for fedora, since it only supports Ubuntu type layouts. Other than that, I will give 5 stars.
summary: Saved me from lots of hassle!

description: If the btrfs bug breaking the program, this would easily be a 5 star product. Really useful utility and it sucks that it`s currently broken
summary: The app itself is great - but broken in Fedora 35

description: can't find any help. no drives, files or folders list.
Great for backups, just works every time.
I push the envelope a little too often but TimeShift has rescued me twice thus far. Highly recommended that you get this on your system and set up! Great insurance.
This program is bricking the OS by just silently baking up its own backup.
Nice app. Very useful. This should be included in to Ubuntu OS as a default app. I love it.
Thing made a 60g file as a back up of a pretty bare ubuntu install.

I once suddenly had a graphics card issue (thanks, nvidia) and my whole screen was distorted. I couldn't get it working and couldn't keep working.

I had regular backups and the latest was just the day before this disaster. Thanks to this app I restored my system as if nothing happened just like it was in the morning. I just really... shifted time back

I recommend making the documentation just a bit more beginner-friendly.
Won't write to Network drives.
Crashes and not open
Sollte Systembestandteil werden.
Ich kann mit Deja nix anfangen, stürzt bei mir dauernd ab. Mit Timeshift habe ich bisher gute Erfahrung gemacht. Sollte fester Bestandteil von Ubuntu werden. Bei MINT ist es ja schon fest dabei.

Warum das nicht in allen Versionen dabei ist,steht
in den Sternen.....

läuft einwandfrei, intuitive Bedienung, genügend Funktionen
Top!
genau was ich brauche..ein voll-backup, inkrementell.. und die nötigsten einstell-optionen.. dass, wäre ein toller linux-bestandteil

Es macht gute Backups.
Leider ist die Oberfläche total unübersichtlich und unmodern.
Hier ist Deja Dup von der Oberfläche her besser.
Vielleicht wäre es eine Lösung, weniger Optionen anzubieten und erweiterte Optionen einblendbar zu machen.

Wer nur ein Backup des Systems machen möchte, der bekommt mit Timeshift ein gutes Tool. Sollen aber die Benutzerverzeichnisse gesichert werden und dabei bestimmte Ordner (z. B. Virtuelle Maschinen, .cache oder .steam) ausgeschlossen werden, dann versagt Timeshift. Egal wie es konfiguriert wird, es sichert immer alles aus den Benutzerverzeichnissen und verschwendet damit viel Zeit und Speicherplatz. In dem Programm gibt es zudem keine Option unsichtbare Verzeichnisse auszuwählen. Benutze nun »Back in Time« dafür, welches diese Einschränkungen nicht hat.

Läuft klasse
Wenn auf dem Rechner etwas schief läuft, kann man das mit wenigen Klicks rückgängig machen.
es excelente lo recomiendo ampliamente
